footnotes.english_saheeh: [1944]- i.e., enlighten, assure and gladden your heart with guidance.

translations.english_saheeh: Did We not expand for you, [O Muḥammad], your breast?[1944]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have We not opened your breast for you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)?
translations.english_rwwad: Have We not reassured your heart for you [O Prophet],

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1945]- By forgiving any errors which you may have committed previously or might commit consequently. "Burden" can also refer to the anxiety experienced by the Prophet (ﷺ) at the beginning of his mission.

translations.english_saheeh: And We removed from you your burden[1945]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And removed from you your burden.
translations.english_rwwad: and relieved you of your burden

translations.english_saheeh: Which had weighed upon your back
And raised high for you your repute.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And have We not raised high your fame?
translations.english_rwwad: and raised high your fame for you?

translations.english_saheeh: For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease [i.e., relief].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, along with every hardship is relief,
translations.english_rwwad: For indeed, with hardship comes ease,

translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, along with every hardship is relief (i.e. there is one hardship with two reliefs, so one hardship cannot overcome two reliefs).

translations.english_saheeh: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So when you have finished (your occupation), devote yourself for Allâh’s worship.
translations.english_rwwad: So whenever you are free, strive in worship,

translations.english_saheeh: And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And to your Lord (Alone) turn (all your) intentions and hopes.
translations.english_rwwad: and turn to your Lord in devotion.
